page.title: 05Ecology
page.content: In the fields in our area there is a lot of wildlife. There are foxes, rabbits, the hare, badgers, squirrels, deer and moles. There are many different types of bird, including owls. There are plenty of trees and hedges in which animals and birds can make their homes. There is the River Stour for fishing and kingfishers and herons can be seen. In the mornings you might hear a cuckoo or the sound of a cockerel from one of the local farms. Nearly every year there is hunting, when people on horseback bring hounds through Milton looking for foxes. The area is almost pollution free and local people are conservation minded. It is a good area for studying natural history.
